# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/msgpack/exceptions.py
@source-hash: 7424d67a2f1da64a
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:01:25Z

**File Purpose**: Exception hierarchy for msgpack library unpacking and packing operations, defining specialized error types for different failure modes during MessagePack serialization/deserialization.

**Core Exception Classes**:
- `UnpackException` (L1-7): Base exception class for unpacking errors. Important note: not all unpack errors inherit from this, some may raise other Exception types
- `BufferFull` (L10-11): Simple exception indicating buffer capacity exceeded during unpacking
- `OutOfData` (L14-15): Raised when unpacker runs out of data before completing operation
- `FormatError` (L18-19): Multiple inheritance from ValueError and UnpackException, indicates invalid msgpack format
- `StackError` (L22-23): Multiple inheritance exception for overly nested data structures during unpacking

**Special Cases**:
- `ExtraData` (L30-43): Exception with custom attributes for one-shot unpacking scenarios where trailing data remains. Contains `unpacked` (parsed data) and `extra` (remaining bytes) attributes, with custom string representation.

**Deprecated Aliases**:
- `UnpackValueError = ValueError` (L27): Legacy alias, use ValueError directly
- `PackException = Exception` (L46): Legacy alias for general packing errors
- `PackValueError = ValueError` (L47): Legacy alias for packing value errors  
- `PackOverflowError = OverflowError` (L48): Legacy alias for packing overflow errors

**Architecture Notes**:
- Uses multiple inheritance pattern (FormatError, StackError inherit from both ValueError and UnpackException)
- Maintains backward compatibility through deprecated aliases
- Clear separation between unpacking exceptions (structured hierarchy) and packing exceptions (aliases to built-ins)
- ExtraData is the only exception with custom behavior (attributes and __str__ method)
